intro: Hibbertia ebracteata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions such as New South Wales and Queensland. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight curl, and it produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Hibbertia ebracteata is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions.
